talks.title: Opening Keynote: The Future of Rust
talks.speaker: Ashley Williams
talks.synopsis: Join us for an exciting look at where Rust is headed in 2026 and beyond. We'll explore the latest language features, the growing ecosystem, and how Rust is reshaping systems programming across industries from embedded devices to cloud infrastructure.

talks.title: Zero-Cost Abstractions in Practice
talks.speaker: Niko Matsakis
talks.synopsis: Dive deep into how Rust achieves its famous zero-cost abstractions. Through practical examples and compiler insights, learn how to write high-level code that compiles down to optimal machine code.

talks.title: Building Your First Async Runtime
talks.speaker: Alice Ryhl
talks.synopsis: A hands-on workshop where we'll build a minimal async runtime from scratch. You'll gain deep understanding of how futures, wakers, and executors work together to power async Rust.

talks.title: WebAssembly with Rust: From Zero to Hero
talks.speaker: Steve Klabnik
talks.synopsis: Learn how to compile Rust to WebAssembly and integrate it into web applications. We'll cover wasm-bindgen, wasm-pack, and build a real-world interactive demo.

talks.title: Growing the Rust Community
talks.speaker: Manish Goregaokar
talks.synopsis: Explore strategies for building inclusive Rust communities worldwide. From meetups to conferences, learn how to foster welcoming spaces for Rustaceans of all skill levels.

talks.title: Error Handling Done Right
talks.speaker: Jane Lusby
talks.synopsis: A comprehensive guide to error handling in Rust. We'll compare different approaches, explore the anyhow and thiserror crates, and establish best practices for library and application code.

talks.title: Building CLI Tools with Clap
talks.speaker: Ed Page
talks.synopsis: Hands-on workshop building professional command-line tools using Clap. Learn about argument parsing, subcommands, shell completions, and creating delightful CLI experiences.

talks.title: Embedded Rust: Programming Microcontrollers
talks.speaker: James Munns
talks.synopsis: Get started with embedded Rust! We'll program real hardware, explore the embedded ecosystem, and learn how Rust's safety guarantees help prevent common embedded bugs.

talks.title: Rust in Production: Lessons Learned
talks.speaker: Sean Chen
talks.synopsis: Real-world experiences deploying Rust at scale. Learn about the challenges, victories, and practical tips from running Rust services handling millions of requests.

talks.title: The Borrow Checker: Friend Not Foe
talks.speaker: Nell Shamrell-Harrington
talks.synopsis: Transform your relationship with the borrow checker. Through mental models and practical patterns, learn to work with Rust's ownership system rather than against it.

talks.title: Contributing to the Rust Compiler
talks.speaker: Felix Klock
talks.synopsis: A beginner-friendly introduction to contributing to rustc. We'll navigate the codebase, find good first issues, and walk through the contribution process.

talks.title: Closing Keynote: Rust's Next Decade
talks.speaker: Josh Triplett
talks.synopsis: Reflecting on how far Rust has come and looking ahead to the next ten years. What challenges remain? What new frontiers will Rust explore? Join us for an inspiring close to Rust Nation UK.

talks.title: Advanced Traits and Generics
talks.speaker: Predrag Gruevski
talks.synopsis: Master advanced trait patterns including associated types, GATs, and trait objects. Learn when to use each approach and how to design flexible, reusable APIs.

talks.title: Optimizing Rust Performance
talks.speaker: Nicholas Nethercote
talks.synopsis: Deep dive into Rust performance optimization. Learn profiling techniques, understand what the compiler does, and discover patterns that help or hurt performance.

talks.title: Lightning Talks
talks.speaker: Various Speakers
talks.synopsis: A rapid-fire session of 5-minute talks from community members covering everything from hobby projects to production war stories. Always surprising, always fun!
